Key Arguments: The legislation represents an overreach of government powers.
It threatens freedom of speech, a fundamental human right.
The proposal could lead to mass censorship and silence dissenting opinions.
The legislation is reminiscent of censorship in authoritarian regimes.
The ACMA would have excessive powers to impose and change standards, potentially punishing digital platforms for non-compliance.
The legislation could lead to a dystopian society where communication is controlled by the government.
Notable Quotes: These so-called proposed Government protections are dangerous, mass censorship is abominable and makes me and my family feel extremely unsafe.
Who decides the truth? The ruling class?
Essentially this legislation will gag the Australian people and the platforms that allow carriage of ideas and voices.
The Government and politicians work for the people, you are mandated to serve NOT to rule.
